Yes, the Chicago Sun-Times has an active social media presence across multiple platforms. The newspaper maintains official accounts on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and other social media platforms, where it posts breaking news, in-depth articles, multimedia content, and engages with readers.

On Twitter, the newspaper has over 430,000 followers and regularly posts articles and breaking news in real-time. On Facebook, the Chicago Sun-Times has over 300,000 likes, where it provides news, commentary, and multimedia content to its followers. On Instagram, the newspaper has over 66,000 followers and focuses on sharing visually stunning images of Chicago and the people that make the city unique.

The Chicago Sun-Times also utilizes social media to engage with its readers by soliciting feedback, answering questions, and participating in online discussions. In addition, the newspaper occasionally holds live events on social media such as Q&A sessions or interviews with notable personalities to allow readers to engage with their content in real-time.

Overall, the Chicago Sun-Times is a newspaper that understands the importance of social media in today's digital age, and they have made a conscious effort to maintain an active and engaging presence on these platforms.
